poem:
**Unlikely Ardor**

Ida quits the dull ring,
pursues a man, baby-faced
Norwegian with a Brechtian bend,
bald and raincoated, yet seen as Adonis,
Scandi-touched,
through love's hasty lens.
Readers, eyes roll,
but in her chaos,
an altered world – desire's crucible.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "If Only by Vigdis Hjorth review – love will tear her apart Aged 30, Oslo-based radio dramatist Ida quits her marriage and hurls herself into the pursuit of a, frankly, unprepossessing man baby of a Norwegian Brecht scholar. She sees him across the street and her frenzied lover’s eye transforms this bald academic with a flapping raincoat into some kind of Scandi Adonis – even though readers may struggle not to cry out: “Mate, you". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
